job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for a technical lead for our DevEx function. Working with a team of around 20 people, you will be responsible for building a strong Developer Experience function within the company.

   The teams are the amalgamation of the former core DevEx team, the Web Platform team and the Backend Tooling team, which were recently merged to focus on the overall mission of delivering a world-class developer experience.

   You will be working as part of the Olympus Unit which provides production and platform engineering services to the whole engineering organisation.

   Your Responsibilities

   It all starts with our vision of a strong Developer Experience and enabling teams to work at their best.

   You collaborate with the engineering teams across the organisation to understand their needs and come to data-driven decisions on how to improve our engineering department. We want to allow every engineer to perform to the best of their ability. Giving them the right tools and spreading knowledge internally is your mission.

   People Leadership To lead the DevEx organisation, you're directly responsible for a small number of Engineering Managers and their teams, guiding the EMs in their growth and providing strategic direction.

   Managing Growth Within the overall operations department, we aim to scale better than the overall growth of the business. You will contribute to this goal by enabling our engineers to deliver more. With our constantly evolving product landscape, you'll never run out of challenges!

   Strategic Leadership: Responsibilities include leading the strategic direction of the team's engagements and collaborating with stakeholders. While not directly involved in software delivery, the role necessitates a profound understanding of technical architecture, potential challenges, and aligning the team's work with broader organisational goals., * Leading leaders: The team currently has two engineering managers who will report to you
     * Strong engineering background, bonus points if parts of our stack are included:

     * C#/.NET with ASP.NET, C++, Typescript, Python or Go
     * Machine learning
     * Open source platforms based around Kubernetes
     * Observability based on open source Grafana stack or comparable
     * Data Science tooling (e.g. batch workload systems, streaming analytics systems etc.), Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.

     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, Austin, or Tokyo, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

     * Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings and company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With up to 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.
     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.
job_details.full_text:
Head of Developer Experience

We are looking for a technical lead for our DevEx function. Working with a team of around 20 people, you will be responsible for building a strong Developer Experience function within the company.

   The teams are the amalgamation of the former core DevEx team, the Web Platform team and the Backend Tooling team, which were recently merged to focus on the overall mission of delivering a world-class developer experience.

   You will be working as part of the Olympus Unit which provides production and platform engineering services to the whole engineering organisation.

   Your Responsibilities

   It all starts with our vision of a strong Developer Experience and enabling teams to work at their best.

   You collaborate with the engineering teams across the organisation to understand their needs and come to data-driven decisions on how to improve our engineering department. We want to allow every engineer to perform to the best of their ability. Giving them the right tools and spreading knowledge internally is your mission.

   People Leadership To lead the DevEx organisation, you're directly responsible for a small number of Engineering Managers and their teams, guiding the EMs in their growth and providing strategic direction.

   Managing Growth Within the overall operations department, we aim to scale better than the overall growth of the business. You will contribute to this goal by enabling our engineers to deliver more. With our constantly evolving product landscape, you'll never run out of challenges!

   Strategic Leadership: Responsibilities include leading the strategic direction of the team's engagements and collaborating with stakeholders. While not directly involved in software delivery, the role necessitates a profound understanding of technical architecture, potential challenges, and aligning the team's work with broader organisational goals., * Leading leaders: The team currently has two engineering managers who will report to you
     * Strong engineering background, bonus points if parts of our stack are included:

     * C#/.NET with ASP.NET, C++, Typescript, Python or Go
     * Machine learning
     * Open source platforms based around Kubernetes
     * Observability based on open source Grafana stack or comparable
     * Data Science tooling (e.g. batch workload systems, streaming analytics systems etc.), Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.

     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, Austin, or Tokyo, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

     * Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings and company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With up to 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.
     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on leadership, people management, and improving developer experience through tools and processes, rather than direct AI/ML development or engineering. While it mentions 'Machine learning' and 'Data Science tooling' as bonus points, these are not core responsibilities.

phrases.phrase: understand their needs and come to data-driven decisions on how to improve our engineering department
phrases.justification: This phrase indicates the need to understand the business context (engineering department needs) and use data to make decisions that align with improving the overall function.

phrases.phrase: aligning the team's work with broader organisational goals
phrases.justification: This directly speaks to understanding the larger business objectives and ensuring the team's efforts contribute to them.

phrases.phrase: focus on the overall mission of delivering a world-class developer experience
phrases.justification: This highlights the overarching business goal that the function is designed to achieve.

phrases.phrase: building a strong Developer Experience function
phrases.justification: While not direct application development, building a 'function' implies creating systems, tools, and processes that support software development.

phrases.phrase: Providing them the right tools
phrases.justification: This implies the development or selection of tools that engineers will use, which can involve software development aspects.

phrases.phrase: parts of our stack are included: C#/.NET with ASP.NET, C++, Typescript, Python or Go
phrases.justification: Mentioning specific programming languages and frameworks suggests an understanding and potential involvement in the software development stack, even if not hands-on coding.

phrases.phrase: Open source platforms based around Kubernetes
phrases.justification: Kubernetes is a platform for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications, directly related to software development infrastructure.

phrases.phrase: Olympus Unit which provides production and platform engineering services
phrases.justification: This indicates a focus on the operational aspects of engineering, including platform services which are akin to MLOps in a broader sense.

phrases.phrase: Open source platforms based around Kubernetes
phrases.justification: Kubernetes is a core technology for container orchestration and managing production environments, a key component of MLOps.

phrases.phrase: Observability based on open source Grafana stack or comparable
phrases.justification: Observability (monitoring, logging, tracing) is a critical aspect of MLOps for maintaining production systems.
